Listening to this album after turning 30, I was just 13 when I fell in love with it. I was a huge Eminem fan as a teenager and I remember taking particular notice of how different this song was and how sweet it was that he sang for his daughters. I think this is my first time watching the video and I'm hit with a new wave of emotions. I love how much he humanized him and Kim here. Seeing those home videos kinda made me understand why they kept going back to each other despite all the abuse...they were a normal family.

Oh wow AS Puerto Rican and songwriter myself I heard this years ago but I wasn't a Father back then I couldn't relate to the punchlines but OMG call me a baby but this got me crying,The government took our kids on some fabricated allegations we fought hard and got em back 2 years pass they took them again because mommy had a pill miscount in her prescription of Clonazepam we fought even harder and to this day they are still with us but the case is still open when they took my twins they were 4 months old and today they are 6 years! now you do the math a case should not be open that long specially when Parents are putting in the work,a lot of it was race things,the foster people threw my baby one of the twins in a pool and watched until he stopped struggling,then he took him out,my baby was dead but Glory be to Almighty God that he sent him back! I was on my knees crying to God and trying to get Him to take me Instead of my baby and I cried I ran out of tears I lost their first and second birthday,first and second Christmas and several other things that only happen once in a lifetime for every kid because they don't stop growing I have 5 kids and I'm 31 years old 3 biological and 2 are step son and step daughter but like I say they're all mine! Won't keep writing more on this comment but If you want to know more hit me up! because this don't ends here this is only the tip of the Iceberg...May God Almighty,The Lord of Hosts and Father of the King that He Raised for us Jesus Christ bless everyone that take the time to actually read all of this! May the Peace of The Lord be with you and with yours...

I really wanna know Hailie’s reaction to this song. Does she ever listen to it? Like I’m not Eminem’s daughter but I can feel his love and care for his little girl and I really hope hailie appreciated this song and holds it close to her heart. 
Idk, this song is soo deep. It’s like a personal letter but in a beautiful song form. The only song that makes me cry everytime I listen to it. It’s a father, feeling like a failure yet staying strong and having hope, for his little girl. Telling her that things are rough, but he’s always there for her. The story of this song, it’s so personal and deep. You can tell Eminem was feeling every emotion and word while he wrote and sang this song. He was literally talking to his daughter through it.He loves his daughter beyond words, you can tell. This is so beautiful. 🥺❤️ this was when rap was the deepest most meaningful genre. It said stories. It held emotions.

One of the most beautiful musical journalings created and shared. My name is Hailey too. I love hearing him express love to his daughter but more so the recognition of what she went through and was put through and his role in it. He wanted the best but still couldn’t provide it. He admits it and doesn’t make her feel guilty for having her own feelings and trauma. He also doesn’t make himself a victim. This is one of the most manly and loving pieces of music to have been shared with the world. Will always be a favorite to me. Hope you’re doing well em, and haillie.

I can definitely relate to Ems from his kids point of view. My parent were struggling ever since they got married and got me, debts and moving houses is a frequent thing my whole life. They were saving up alot to build me a home, a tuition, everything was literally their blood and tears. I had to move to my grandparents house because mom and dad were handling the debts in the city. They finally can afford for me living with them after 2 year of my dad fighting with depression, he couldnt go to work so mom have to carried him through all of it. The next few years they got a little better with financial problems, but things kept going up and down, they fought alot over it too. And after years and years of struggling, finally they bought a house, at that moment, i think life is way better than it used to be, but then mom got cancer. After two years of battling with cancer, she passed away and a few months right before mom's passing, dad went to jail because of some mixed up, so they never had a chance to see each other the last time, at the time, i was dealing with mental health problems so its hard for me to actually talk to mom and tell her goodbye, still my biggest regret ever. My parent were trying so hard just to make me smile and i have so much respect for them.

Rest in Peace, Momma, you and Dad deserve the world
